Intelligent, good-natured, and valiant, there could be no concern that it would ever attack people. Some parents even trust it to babysit.
Their deceptively cute act is the perfect ruse. They steal from people for fun, but their victims can't help but forgive them.
Many Trainers are drawn to their beautiful form and fur. These Pokémon vanish and appear unexpectedly. They run silently in the night.
This Pokémon dwells deep in the forest. It's good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It's kind enough to share them with friends.
Ill tempered, it attacks enemies by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.
The fire within the tuft on its head can reach up to 600ºF. Very intelligent, it roasts berries before eating them. It likes to help people.
It loves sweets because they become energy for the fire burning inside its body. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents.
The water stored inside the tuft of its head is rich in nutrients. It waters plants using its tail, plants that receive its water grow large.
It can shoot highly-pressurised water from its tail with enough power to break through a solid concrete wall. It prefers places with clean water.
This Pokémon appears before people and Pokémon who are having nightmares and eats those dreams. Munna always float in the air.
The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and Pokémon. It changes into different colors depending on the dream that was eaten.
This very forgetful Pokémon will wait for a new order from its Trainer even though it already has one. Flocks often gather in parks and plazas.
No matter where in the world it goes, it knows where its nest is, so it can always return to its Trainer's location regardless of the distance.
Males have plumage on their heads. The females' flying abilities surpass those of the males. They will only let themselves feel close to their Trainers.
Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate with one another.
When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates. It is dangerous when it's angry as it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.
The hexagonal cavity is its ear. It walks in the direction of sounds it hears, but if the sounds cease, it panics and topples over.
Its orange crystal is a mass of energy. Just one crystal fragment would provide enough fuel for a hundred dump trucks. When it is healthy, its core sticks out.
The blasts of energy it makes from sunbeams have terrifying power. However, it's not able to fire its blasts at night or on rainy days.
Its habitat is dark forests and caves. Suction from its nostrils enables it to stick to cave walls during sleep. It leaves a heart-shaped mark behind.
Anyone who comes into contact with the ultrasonic waves emitted by a courting male experiences a positive mood shift.
It can dig through the ground at a speed of 30 mph by spinning its body. It could give a car running aboveground a good race.
More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels, but it can also help with construction.
Its auditory sense is astounding. Using the feelers on its ears, it can tell how someone is feeling or when an egg might hatch. );
These Pokémon appear at building sites and help out with construction. They always carry squared logs. As they grow, they carry bigger logs.
They strengthen their bodies by carrying steel beams. This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.
They use concrete pillars as walking canes. Rather than rely solely on force, they master moves that utilize the centrifugal force of spinning concrete.
By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans. It uses the rhythm of these sounds to talk and warns others of danger.
It lives in the water and on land. When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, they can make waves in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.
It increases the power of its punches by vibrating the bumps on its fists. They can also shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps.
When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts. It changes belts as it gets more powerful.
The sound of Sawk punching boulders and trees can be heard all the way from the mountains where they train. Disturbing their training angers them.
It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth. Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes, it is a mascot for fashion designers.
Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.
It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to weave warm wrappings for Sewaddle by using the silk secreted from its mouth.
Using the feelers on its head and tail, it picks up vibrations in the air to determine its prey's location and state. It is brutally aggressive.
Storing energy for evolution, it sits. But when attacked, it spins its body at high speed like a wheel and then crashes furiously into its opponent.
With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails. Then it finishes them off with deadly poison.
When it finds others of its kind, they all stick together. When enough of them have collected, the mass resembles a cumulonimbus cloud.
It rides on the wind and slips into people's homes. After it has turned a room into a cotton-filled mess, it giggles to itself and takes off.
By pruning the leaves on its head with regularity, this Pokémon can be grown into a fine plump shape. These bitter leaves refresh those who eat them.
Even veteran Trainers face a challenge in getting its beautiful flower to bloom. It withers away if a trainer does not take good care of it.
Red and blue Basculin usually do not get along, but sometimes members of one school mingle with the other's school. These Pokémon are very hostile.
It conceals itself in the sand and chomps down on the legs of any prey that unwarily walk over it. Its favorite food is Trapinch.
They move in groups of a few individuals. Thanks to the special membrane covering its eyes, it can see its surroundings clearly, even in the dead of night.
Very violent Pokémon, they never allow their prey to escape. Their jaws are so powerful, they can crush the body of an automobile.
When its internal fire is burning, it cannot calm down and it runs around. When the fire diminishes, it pulls its limbs into its body and falls asleep.
When one is injured in a fierce battle, it transforms into a stone statue. Then it meditates and sharpens its mind and fights on mentally.
Arid regions are their habitat. When it moves rhythmically, it makes a sound similar to maracas, making the surprised Pokémon flee.
It makes a hole in a stone of a suitable size. If that rock breaks, the Pokémon remains agitated until it locates a replacement.
Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle and begins to weaken.
Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck. Its skull is massively thick.
Groups of them beat up anything that enters their territory. The one with the biggest crest is the group leader, and is the most respected.
The guardians of an ancient city, they always fly the same route while keeping watch for invaders. They use their psychic power to attack enemies.
These Pokémon arose from the spirits of people interred in graves in past ages. Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human.
Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies. Their bodies are covered in pure gold. );
A powerful curse was woven into an ancient painting. After absorbing the spirit of a Yamask, the painting began to move.
Reputed to be the ancestor of most turtle Pokémon, it lived in warm seas about a hundred million years ago. It was restored from a fossil.
They can live both in the ocean and on land. Incredible jaw strength enables them to chew up steel beams and rocks along with their prey.
Said to be the ancestor of all bird Pokémon, Archen itself could not actually fly but moved by hopping from treetop to treetop.
They are intelligent and will cooperate to catch prey. When one Archeops had the prey cornered, another would swoop on it.
It gorges on trash until its stomach is full. Then it belches toxic gas. An unlucky whiff of this gas will put a person in the hospital.
Beware the poisonous liquid it shoots from its right arm. If even a little of it gets on you, you'll experience the full effects of this unidentified toxin.
To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokémon. Apparently, it often transforms into a silent child.
Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong. It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents. They defend their lair with illusory scenery.
These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat. They greet one another by rubbing each other with their tails, which are always kept well groomed and clean.
Their white fur feels amazing to touch. Cinccino's body is coated in a special oil that repels dust and helps it deflect attacks, such as punches.
They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, Gothita are looking at something that only they can see. Their ribbonlike feelers increase their power.
Starlight is the source of their power. They use hypnosis to control people and Pokémon. Tales of Gothorita leading them astray are told in every corner.
Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power. When it learns its Trainer's life span, it cries in sadness.
Because their bodies are enveloped in a special liquid, they are fine in any environment, no matter how severe. They can use telepathy to talk with others.
When their brains, now divided in two, are thinking the same thoughts, these Pokémon exhibit their maximized psychic power.
They use psychic power to control their arms, which are made of a special liquid. When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains.
These bird Pokémon are excellent divers. They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.
Despite their elegant appearance, they can flap their wings strongly and fly for thousands of miles. The one in the middle is the leader of the flock.
The temperature of their breath is -58ºF. They create snow crystals and make snow fall in the areas around them. Vanillite is treasured by households in warm regions.
Vanillish has existed since the Ice Age. It controls particles of ice, freezes its opponents, and then shatters them with a headbutt.
Each of its two heads has a brain, and when they are in agreement, it attacks its enemies by exhaling a violent blizzard. It makes snow clouds inside its body.
Their coloring changes according to the seasons and can be slightly affected by the temperature and humidity as well. People use it to mark the seasons.
Some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring because the plants growing on its horns change according to the season. The leader possesses magnificent horns.
It glides using its cape-like membrane. It grills berries and bug Pokémon with electric shocks from the pouches on its cheeks and makes a meal of them.
When they feel threatened, they spit an acidic liquid to drive attackers away. For some reason they evolve while they are in the same place as Shelmet.
Wearing the shell covering they stole from Shelmet, they defend themselves and attack with two lances. The steel armor protects their whole body.
It lures Pokémon in with its pattern that looks just like a Poké Ball, then releases its poison spores. Why it resembles a Poké Ball is unknown.
It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion, but very few Pokémon are fooled by this.
If its veil-like arms stun and wrap an opponent, that foe will be dragged five miles below the surface to its lair, never to return.
They propel themselves by expelling absorbed seawater from their bodies. It's said there's a castle of ships Jellicent have sunk on the seafloor.
When they find a wounded Pokémon, they embrace it and bring it to shore. The special membrane enveloping Alomomola has the ability to heal wounds.
Since they can't generate their own electricity, they attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in a pouch.
It creates barriers from electrified silk that stun foes. This works as a weapon as well as a defense. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.
It absorbs the iron it finds in the rock while clinging to the ceiling of caves. When threatened, it attacks by shooting a barrage of spikes.
It fights by swinging around its three spiky feelers and shooting spikes. A hit from these steel spikes can reduce a boulder to rubble.
Two bodies comprise a fixed pair. The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.
A minigear and big gear comprise its body. Spinning minigears are rotated at high speed and repeatedly fired away. It is dangerous if the gears don't return.
Its red core functions as an energy tank. It is rotated at high speed for a rapid energy charge. It fires the charged energy through its spikes into an area.
These Pokémon move in schools. One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.
These Pokémon have a big appetite. It wraps itself around its prey and paralyzes it with electricity from the round spots on its sides. Then it chomps.
They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean, with their sucker mouths.
It psychically squeezes the brain of its foe, causing unendurable headaches. Rumors of its origin are linked to a UFO crash site in the desert 50 years ago.
It can manipulate an opponent's memory. Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three fingers, but those patterns haven't been decoded.
While Litwick shines a light and pretends to be a guide, it absorbs the life force of any who follow it, which becomes the fuel that it burns.
This ominous Pokémon is feared. Through cities it wanders, searching for the spirits of the fallen. The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire.
Being consumed in Chandelure's flame burns up the spirit, leaving the body behind. By waving the flames on its arms, it puts its foes into a hypnotic trance.
They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly, harder and sturdier than the last.
Their tusks can shatter rocks. A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.
They are kind but can be relentless when defending territory. Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams.
Its nose is always running. Their snot is a barometer of health. When healthy, their snot is sticky and the power of their ice moves increases.
It freezes its breath to create fangs and claws of ice to fight with. Very able in the water, it swims around in northern seas and catches prey.
They are born in snow clouds. When its body temperature goes up, it turns into steam and vanishes. When its temperature lowers, it returns to ice.
When attacked, it defends itself by closing the lid of its shell. It evolves when bathed in an electric-like energy along with Karrablast.
When its body dries out, it weakens. So, to prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in layers of thin membrane. It is very light and fights with ninja-like movements.
It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of electricity. It smiles when transmitting electricity.
They have mastered elegant combos. As they concentrate, their battle moves become swifter and more precise. What it lacks in power, it makes up for in quantity.
They use the long fur on their arms as a whip to strike their opponents. Its arm attacks come with such rapidity that they cannot even be seen.
It warms its body by absorbing sunlight with its wings. When its body temperature falls, it can no longer move. It uses its sharp claws to catch prey.
These Pokémon are thought to have been created by the science of an ancient and mysterious civilization. It's been active for thousands of years.
Golurk were created to protect people and Pokémon by an ancient civilisation. Removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.
Ignoring their injuries, groups attack by sinking the blades that cover their bodies into their prey. If battling dulls them, it sharpens them on stones by the river.
This pitiless Pokémon commands a group of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility. It battles to become the boss, but will be driven from the group if it loses.
Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt. Their headbutts have enough destructive force to derail a train.
With its sharp claws, this Pokémon pierces its prey, and then it pecks at them. Although it also consumes berries, it's a carnivore at heart.
For the sake of its friends, this brave warrior of the sky will not stop battling, even if it is injured. One can carry a car while flying.
It can't fly yet and must wait until its wings have developed more. They guard their posteriors with bones that were gathered by Mandibuzz.
They adorn themselves beautifully with bones. This is supposedly an effort to attract males, but no male Mandibuzz have ever been found.
It draws in air through its tail, transforms it into fire, and uses it like a tongue. They burn through Durant's steel bodies and consume their insides.
Durant dig nests in mountains. Individuals each play different roles in driving Heatmor, their natural predator, away from their colony.
Lacking sight, it's unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves. Approaching it carelessly is dangerous.
After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves on to another area. Whichever head eats more than the other gets to be the leader.
This brutal Pokémon travels the skies on its six wings. The heads on their arms do not have brains. They use all three heads to consume and destroy everything.
This Pokémon was believed to have been born from the sun. It spews fire from its horns and encases itself in a cocoon of fire when it evolves.
When volcanic ash darkened the atmosphere, it appeared and saved Pokémon from freezing, Volcarona's fire provided a replacement for the sun.
It has a body and heart of steel. This legendary Pokémon battled against humans to protect Pokémon. Its personality is calm and composed.
Spoken of in legend, this Pokémon used its phenomenal power to destroy a castle in its effort to protect Pokémon that had lost their homes in a war among humans.
Its head sprouts horns as sharp as blades. Legends say this Pokémon used whirlwind-like movements to confound and swiftly cut its opponents.
Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power can blow entire houses away. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.
The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. Countless charred remains mar the landscape of places through which Thundurus has passed.
The energy that comes pouring from its tail increases the nutrition in the soil, making crops grow to great size. It has been hailed as “The Guardian of the Fields.”
This Pokémon appears in legends. It sends flames into the air from its tail, burning up everything around it. It helps those who want to build a world of truth.
This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with lightning. It has a generator that creates electricity in its tail. It assists those with strong ideals.
This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals. Its body became frozen when its energy leaked out.
When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. It crosses the world, running over the surfaces of oceans and rivers.
The melodies sung by Meloetta have the power to make Pokémon that hear them happy or sad. Many famous songs have been inspired by the tunes that Meloetta plays.
Over 300 million years ago, it was feared as the strongest of hunters. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.
The quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock without any effort.
They strengthen the sturdy shell covering their bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won't start fights, but will counterattack with sharp quills.
It shields its allies from danger with its own body. When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it can withstand a bomb blast.
As it walks, it munches on a twig to fill itself with energy in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its roomy ears.
Braixen has a twig stuck in its tail. When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.
It gazes into the flame at the tip of its branch to achieve a focused state, which allows it to see into the future. It uses psychic power to incinerate its foes.
It protects its skin by covering its body in bubbles it secretes from its chest and back. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.
It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away. Frogadier's swiftness is unparalleled.
It appears and vanishes with a ninja's grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars made of compressed water.
It has ears like shovels. Digging holes strengthens its ears so much that they can sever thick roots effortlessly. Bunnelby dig the whole night through.
With its powerful ears it reduces dense bedrock to rubble. It can be a big help at construction sites. When it's finished digging, it lounges about lazily.
This amiable Pokémon is easy to train. But when battle is joined, it shows its ferocious side. It's merciless to intruders that enter its territory.
From its beak, it expels embers that set the tall grass on fire. Then it pounces on any bewildered Pokémon that pop out of the grass.
In the fever of an exciting battle, it showers embers from the gaps between its feathers and takes to the air. It finishes its prey off with a colossal kick.
When under attack from bird Pokémon, it spews a poisonous black powder that causes paralysis on contact. Scatterbug can live in any region or climate.
It lives hidden within thicket shadows. When predators attack, it quickly bristles the fur covering its body in an effort to threaten them.
Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat. It scatters colorful scales.
They set off on their own from their pride and live by themselves to become stronger. These hot-blooded Pokémon are quick to start a fight.
The male with the largest mane of fire is the leader of the pride. The females protect the pride's cubs. They viciously threaten any challenger.
When it finds a flower it likes, it dwells on that flower its whole life long. It floats on the wind's embrace with an untroubled heart.
When the flowers of a well-tended flower bed bloom, it appears and celebrates with an elegant dance. It draws out the power of flowers to battle.
It claims exquisite flower gardens as its territory. In times long past, governors of castles would invite Florges to create gardens to embellish the castle domains.
If it has sunshine and water, it doesn't need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back. It has a placid disposition.
It can tell how its trainer is feeling by subtle shifts in the grip on its horns. This empathetic sense lets them run as if one being. They inhabit mountainous regions.
There's no point to the leaf in its mouth, aside from an effort to look cool. It's mischievous, so it's not well suited to inexperienced Trainers.
It boasts superb physical strength. Those who wish to become Pangoro's Trainer have no choice but to converse with their fists.
Trimming its fluffy fur not only makes it more elegant but also increases the swiftness of its movements. These Pokémon were the guardians of kings.
It has enough psychic energy to blast everything within 300 feet of itself. The organ that emits its intense psychic power is sheltered by its ears.
The eyeball patterns on the interior of its ears emit psychic energy. It keeps the patterns tightly covered because that power is too immense.
If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that person's arm and drains that person's life energy completely.
When Honedge evolves, it divides into two swords. The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even against those skilled at swordplay.
Generations of kings were attended to by these Pokémon, which used their spectral power to manipulate and control people and Pokémon.
In the past, rather than using perfume, royal ladies carried a Spritzee that would waft a fragrance they liked. Its fragrance changes depending on what it has eaten.
Its scent is so overpowering that, unless a Trainer happens to really enjoy the smell, he or she will have a hard time walking alongside it.
Because it eats nothing but sweets, its fur is as sticky sweet as cotton candy. To entangle its opponents in battle, it extrudes sticky white threads.
Slurpuff can distinguish even the faintest of scents. It puts its sensitive sense of smell to use by helping pastry chefs in their work.
It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body, which drains its opponent's will to fight. It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.
It lures prey close with hypnotic motions, then wraps its tentacles around it before finishing it off with digestive fluids. It forces others to do whatever it wants.
They stretch and then contract, yanking their rocks along with them in bold hops. They eat seaweed that washes up on the shoreline.
Barbaracle's legs and hands have minds of their own, and they will move independently. But they usually follow the head's orders.
Camouflaged as rotten kelp, it hides from foes while storing up power for its evolution. They spray liquid poison on prey that approach unawares.
Their poison is strong enough to eat through the hull of a tanker. Tales are told of ships that wander into seas where Dragalge live, never to return.
Through controlled expulsions of internal gas, it can expel water like a pistol shot. At close distances, it can even shatter large rocks.
By expelling water from the nozzle in the back of its enormous claw, it can move at a speed of 60 knots. They launch cannonballs made of water.
They make their home in deserts. They can generate their own energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.
A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper. It can stimulate its muscles with electricity, boosting the strength in its legs.
Its immense jaws have enough destructive force that it can chew up a car. If something happens that it doesn't like, it throws a tantrum and runs wild.
Thanks to its gargantuan jaws, which could shred thick metal plates as if they were paper, it was invincible in the ancient world it once inhabited.
This ancient Pokémon was restored from part of its body that had been frozen in ice for over 100 million years. It lived in a cold land where there were no predators.
Using the diamond-shaped crystals on its body it can instantly create a wall of ice to block an opponent's attack, or encase them in ice.
Its ribbonlike feelers give off an aura that weakens hostility in its prey, causing them to let down their guard. A moment later, it pounces.
With its wings, it controls its position in the air. Its proficient fighting skills enable it to keep up with big bruisers like Machamp and Hariyama.
Its whiskers serve as antennas. By sending and receiving electrical waves, it can communicate with others over vast distances.
Born from the high temperatures and pressures deep underground, it defends itself by firing beams from the jewel part of its body.
Its source of protection is its slimy, germ-laden mucous membrane. Anyone who touches it will need some thorough hand-washing.
This Pokémon's mucous can dissolve anything. Toothless, it sprays mucous on its prey. Once they're nicely dissolved, it slurps them up.
It gets picked on because it's meek. But then, whoever teased it gets to feel the full force of its horns and a good swatting from its thick tail.
These key collectors threaten any attackers by fiercely jingling their keys at them. It will sneak into people's homes to steal their keys.
According to legend, medicine to cure any illness can be made by plucking the green leaves on its head, brewing them, and boiling down the liquid.
Through its roots, it exerts control over other trees. A deadly curse falls upon anyone cutting down trees in forests where Trevenant dwell. );
It is said to carry wandering spirits to the place where they belong so they can move on. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active. );
Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. Anyone who hears their song will become inflicted with a curse.
It blocks opponents' attacks with the ice that shields its body. It uses cold air to repair any cracks with new ice. They live in herds on snowy mountains.
The way several Bergmite huddle on its back make it look like an aircraft carrier made of ice. Its cumbersome frame crushes anything that stands in its way.
They live in pitch-black caves. Even a robust wrestler will become dizzy and unable to stand when exposed to its 200,000-hertz ultrasonic waves.
They fly around on moonless nights and attack careless prey. The ultrasonic waves it emits from its ears can reduce a large boulder to pebbles.
Legends say that when the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is sharing everlasting life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree
When its life comes to an end, its wings and tail spread wide and glow red, and it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon.
It's said to be monitoring the ecosystem from deep in the caves where it lives. There are rumors that even greater power lies hidden within its cells.
A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world. It creates diamonds between its hands.
In its true form, it possess a huge amount of power. When its powers are sealed away, it is transformed into a much smaller form. It teleports things to a secret place.
It lets out billows of steam from the arms on its back and disappears into the dense fog. It's said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.
This wary Pokémon uses photosynthesis to store up energy during the day, while becoming active at night. Silently it glides, drawing near to its target.
A bit of a dandy, it spends its free time preening its wings. Its preoccupation with any dirt on its plumage can leave it unable to battle.
Decidueye is cool and cautious. It fires arrow quills from its wings with such precision, they can pierce a pebble at distances of over a hundred yards.
While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.
At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever this Pokémon spits fire. With a single punch, it can bend an iron bar right over.
This Pokémon has a violent, selfish disposition. If it's not in the mood to listen, it will ignore its Trainer's orders with complete nonchalance.
This Pokémon snorts body fluids from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. It practices diligently so it can learn to make big bubbles.
It cares deeply for its companions. When its Trainer is feeling down, it performs a cheery dance with a sequence of water balloons  to try and help.
It controls its water balloons with song. The melody is learned from others of its kind and is passed down from one generation to the next.
This Pokémon feeds on berries, whose leftover seeds become the ammunition for the attacks it fires off from its mouth. It uses holes in trees for nesting.
By bending its beak, it can produce a variety of calls and brand itself a noisy nuisance for its neighbors. It eats berries and stores their seeds in its beak.
When it battles, within its beak, its internal gases ignite, explosively launching seeds with enough power to pulverize boulders.
With its sharp fangs, it will bite anything. It wanders around in a never-ending search for food. At dusk, it collapses and falls asleep on the spot.
When it finds a trace of its prey, it patiently stakes out the location... but as it's diurnal, it's always snoozing by nightfall.
They often gather near places frequented by electric Pokémon in order to avoid being attacked by bird Pokémon, though it normally lives underground.
From the food it digests, it generates electricity, and it stores this energy in its electric sac. On camping trips, people are grateful to have one around.
It concentrates electrical energy within its large jaws and uses it to zap its foes. It overwhelms bird Pokémon with shocking beams of electrical energy.
While guarding its weak points with its pincers, it looks for an opening and unleashes punches. When it loses, it foams at the mouth and faints.
It aimed for the top but got lost and ended up on a snowy mountain. Being forced to endure the cold, this Pokémon evolved and grew thick fur.
Oricorio can change its body by sipping different coloured nectar. It's enemies' hearts melt at the sight of its varying, beautiful dances.
Myriads of Cutiefly flutter above the heads of people who have auras resembling those of flowers. It can identify which flowers are about to bloom.
Ribombee rolls up pollen into puffs. It makes many different varieties, some used as food and others used in battle. They are sometimes sold as supplements.
This Pokémon has lived with people since times long ago. It can sense when its Trainer is in the dumps and will stick close by its Trainer's side.
Well equipped with claws and fangs, it also uses the sharp rocks in its mane as weapons. It will attack with no regard for its own safety.
When it's in trouble, its eyes moisten and begin to shine. The shining light attracts its comrades, and they stand together against their enemies.
It's found crawling on beaches and seafloors. The coral that grows on Corsola's head is as good as a five-star banquet to this Pokémon.
Those attacked by Toxapex's poison will suffer intense pain for three days and three nights. Post-recovery, there will be some aftereffects.
The mud stuck to Mudbray's hooves enhances its grip and its powerful running gait. Eating dirt, making mud, and playing in the mire form its daily routine.
Its heavy, mud-covered kicks are its best means of attack, and it can reduce large trucks to scrap without breaking a sweat.
It crawls onto the land in search of food. When it comes across enemies or potential prey, this Pokémon smashes its water-bubble-covered head into them. );
Despite what its appearance suggests, it cares for others. If it finds vulnerable, weak Pokémon, it protectively brings them into its water bubble.
During the day, it sleeps and soaks up light. They give off a sweet and refreshing scent. Cutiefly often gather near the tall grass where Fomantis are hiding.
It requires a lot of effort to maintain Lurantis's vivid coloring, but some collectors enjoy this work and treat it as their hobby.
As it drowses the day away, it nourishes itself by sucking from tree roots. It wakens at the fall of night, wandering off in search of a new tree.
Forests where Shiinotic live are treacherous to enter at night. People confused by its strange lights can never find their way home again.
It burns its bodily fluids to create a sweet-smelling poisonous gas. When its enemies become disoriented from inhaling the gas, it attacks them.
For some reason, only females have been found. It creates a reverse harem of male Salandit to live with. Its poisonous gas is filled with pheromones.
Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry and flails about, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling. It's an incredibly dangerous Pokémon.
This Pokémon has the habit of hugging its companions. Many Trainers have left this world after their spines were squashed by its hug.
A delectable aroma pours from its body.  Bounsweet's sweat can be watered down into a juice with just the right amount of sweetness.
The sepals on its head developed to protect its body. These are quite hard, so even if pecked by bird Pokémon, this Pokémon is totally fine.
Its long, striking legs aren't just for show but to be used to kick with skill. In victory, it shows off by kicking the defeated, laughing boisterously.
It attaches flowers to its nutritious vine. Baths prepared with the flowers from its vine have a relaxing effect, so this Pokémon is a hit with many people.
Deep in the jungle, high in the lofty canopy, this Pokémon abides. On rare occasions, it shows up at the beach to match wits with Slowking.
They battle with hard berries for weapons. They form groups of about 20 individuals. Their techniques are passed from the boss to the group, generation upon generation.
This Pokémon is a coward. As it desperately dashes off, the flailing of its many legs leaves a sparkling clean path in its wake. It lives on beaches and seabeds.
It battles skillfully with its six arms, with a flashing slash of its giant sharp claws, it cleaves seawater  or even air  right in two.
It takes control of anyone who puts a hand in its mouth, to add to the accumulation of its sand-mound body. This Pokémon embodies the grudges of the departed.
Possessed people controlled by this Pokémon transformed its sand mound into a castle. As it evolved, its power to curse grew ever stronger.
It lives in shallow seas, such as areas near a beach. The sticky mucous that covers their bodies can be used to soothe sunburned skin. How convenient!
Due to the danger that this synthetic Pokémon may go on a rampage, it wears a control mask to restrain its capabilities. It has some hidden special power.
Its trust in its partner awakens it. This Pokémon is capable of changing its type by equipping special memories, a trait that is well displayed in battle.
Originally making its home in the ozone layer, it hurtles to the ground when the shell encasing its body grows too heavy. It was born from mutated nanoparticles.
It is born asleep, and it dies asleep. All its movements are apparently no more than the results of it tossing and turning in its dreams.
The shell on its back is chemically unstable and explodes violently if struck. The hole in its stomach is its weak point. It gushes fire from its nostrils.
The spiny fur on its back is normally at rest. When this Pokémon becomes agitated, its fur stands on end and stabs into its attackers.
A lonely Pokémon, it hides its terrifying appearance beneath an old rag so it can get closer to people and other Pokémon. Its actual appearance is unknown.
It stuns its prey with its psychic powers and then grinds them to mush with its strong teeth. Even Shellder's shell is no match for it.
This Pokémon is friendly to people and loves children most of all. It comes from deep in the mountains to play with children it likes in town.
The soul of seaweed adrift in the waves became reborn as this Pokémon. It maintains itself with new infusions of seabed detritus and seaweed.
It expresses its feelings by smacking its scales. Metallic sounds echo through the tall mountains where Jangmo-o live. They grow little by little battling one another.
It sheds and regrows its scales on a continuous basis. The scales become harder each time they're regrown. Its scaly punches tear its foes to shreds.
Its rigid scales function as offense and defense. In the past, its scales were processed and used to make weapons and other valuable commodities.
It confuses its enemies by flying too quickly for the eye to follow. It has a hair-trigger temper but forgets what made it angry an instant later.
A fragrant aroma of flowers follows it. As it flutters about, it scatters its strangely glowing scales. Touching them is said to restore good health.
It causes vegetation to grow, and then it absorbs energy from the growth. It pulls large trees up by the roots and swings them around at its enemies.
People say it can create pure water that will wash away any corruption. The dense fog it creates brings the downfall and destruction of its confused enemies.
In ages past, it was called the child of the stars. It's said to be a Pokémon from another world, but no specific details are known.
Motionless as if dead, its body is faintly warm to the touch. There's something accumulating around the black core within its hard shell.
It is said to live in another world. The intense light it radiates from the surface of its body can make the darkest of nights light up like midday.
When its third eye activates, away it flies to another world. This Pokémon devours light, drawing the moonless dark veil of night over the brightness of day.
One of several mysterious Ultra Beasts. It's unclear whether or not this Pokémon is sentient, but sometimes it can be observed behaving like a young girl.
This life-form called an Ultra Beast appeared from another world. It shows off its body, but whether that display is a boast or a threat remains unclear.
One of the dangerous Ultra Beasts, it refuses to touch anything, perhaps because it senses some uncleanness in this world.
One of the mysterious life-forms known as Ultra Beasts. Astonishing electric shocks emanate from its entire body, according to witnesses.
It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. One kind of Ultra Beast, witnesses saw it flying across the sky by expelling gas from its two arms.
This Ultra Beast came from the Ultra Wormhole. It seems not to attack enemies on its own, but its sharp body is a dangerous weapon in itself.
A dangerous Ultra Beast, it has gobbled mountains and swallowed whole buildings, according to reports. But for some reason its droppings have never been found.
Reminiscent of the Ultra Beasts, this life-form, apparently asleep underground, is thought to have come from another world in ancient times.
This artificial Pokémon, constructed more than 500 years ago, can understand human speech but cannot itself speak. Its true self is its Soul-Heart, an artificial soul.
Able to conceal itself in the shadows of others, it never appears before humans, so its very existence is the stuff of myth. This Pokémon is craven and cowering.
This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.
It stores hundreds of liters of poisonous liquid inside its body. It is one of the organisms known as UBs.
It appeared from an Ultra Wormhole. Each one appears to be made up of many life- forms stacked one on top of each other.
It slithers toward people and explode its head without warning. It is one kind of Ultra Beast.
It approaches its enemies at the speed of lightning, then tears them limb from limb with its sharp claws.
It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.
Revered long ago for its capacity to create iron from nothing, for some reason it has come back to life after 3,000 years.
When it uses its special stick to strike up a beat, the sound waves produced carry revitalizing energy to the plants and flowers in the area.
The faster a Thwackey can beat out a rhythm with its two sticks, the more respect it wins from its peers.
By drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.
A warm-up of running around gets fire energy coursing through this Pokémon's body. Once that happens, it's ready to fight at full power.
Its thick and fluffy fur protects it from the cold and enables it to use hotter fire moves.
It juggles a pebble with its feet, turning it into a burning soccer ball. Its shots strike opponents hard and leave them scorched.
When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won't be able to resist weeping.
A clever combatant, this Pokémon battles using water balloons created with moisture secreted from its palms.
It has many hidden capabilities, such as fingertips that can shoot water and a membrane on its back that it can use to glide through the air.
Found throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon becomes uneasy if its cheeks are ever completely empty of berries.
It stashes berries in its tail  so many berries that they fall out constantly. But this Pokémon is a bit slow-witted, so it doesn't notice the loss.
It will bravely challenge any opponent, no matter how powerful. This Pokémon benefits from every battle  even a defeat increases its strength a bit.
Smart enough to use tools in battle, these Pokémon have been seen picking up rocks and flinging them or using ropes to wrap up enemies.
This Pokémon reigns supreme in the skies of the Galar region. The black luster of its steel body could drive terror into the heart of any foe.
A constant collector of information, this Pokémon is very smart. Very strong is what it isn't.
It barely moves, but it's still alive. Hiding in its shell without food or water seems to have awakened its psychic powers.
It's famous for its high level of intelligence, and the large size of its brain is proof that it also possesses immense psychic power.
Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of other Pokémon. It survives off its ill-gotten gains.
It secretly marks potential targets with a scent. By following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.
It anchors itself in the ground with its single leg, then basks in the sun. After absorbing enough sunlight, its petals spread as it blooms brilliantly.
The seeds attached to its cotton fluff are full of nutrients. It spreads them on the wind so that plants and other Pokémon can benefit from them.
Its curly fleece is such an effective cushion that this Pokémon could fall off a cliff and stand right back up at the bottom, unharmed.
Weave a carpet from its springy wool, and you end up with something closer to a trampoline. You'll start to bounce the moment you set foot on it.
Apparently the itch of its teething impels it to snap its jaws at anything in front of it.
With jaws that can shear through steel rods, this highly aggressive Pokémon chomps down on its unfortunate prey.
This Pokémon is very popular as a herding dog in the Galar region. As it runs, it generates electricity from the base of its tail.
This Pokémon generates electricity and channels it into its legs to keep them going strong. Boltund can run nonstop for three full days.
Most of its body has the same composition as coal. Fittingly, this Pokémon was first discovered in coal mines about 400 years ago.

It's usually peaceful, but the vandalism of mines enrages it. Offenders will be incinerated with flames that reach 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit.
It spends its entire life inside an apple. It hides from its natural enemies, bird Pokémon, by pretending it's just an apple and nothing more.
It ate a sour apple, and that induced its evolution. In its cheeks, it stores an acid capable of causing chemical burns.

As it digs, it swallows sand and stores it in its neck pouch. The pouch can hold more than 17 pounds of sand.
When it contracts its body, over 220 pounds of sand sprays from its nose. If it ever runs out of sand, it becomes disheartened.
It's so strong that it can knock out some opponents in a single hit, but it also may forget what it's battling midfight.
If it sees any movement around it, this Pokémon charges for it straightaway, leading with its sharply pointed jaw. It's very proud of that jaw.
This Pokémon has a jaw that's as sharp as a spear and as strong as steel. Apparently Barraskewda's flesh is surprisingly tasty, too.
It stores poison in an internal poison sac and secretes that poison through its skin. If you touch this Pokémon, a tingling sensation follows.
When this Pokémon sounds as if it's strumming a guitar, it's actually clawing at the protrusions on its chest to generate electricity.
It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to generate heat. The yellow sections on its belly get particularly hot.

It's very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.
A body made up of nothing but muscle makes the grappling moves this Pokémon performs with its tentacles tremendously powerful.
This Pokémon is said to have been born when a lonely spirit possessed a cold, leftover cup of tea.
This species lives in antique teapots. Most pots are forgeries, but on rare occasions, an authentic work is found.
Via the protrusion on its head, it senses other creatures' emotions. If you don't have a calm disposition, it will never warm up to you.
No matter who you are, if you bring strong emotions near this Pokémon, it will silence you violently.
It emits psychic power strong enough to cause headaches as a deterrent to the approach of others.
Through its nose, it sucks in the emanations produced by people and Pokémon when they feel annoyed. It thrives off this negative energy.

Its shell is overflowing with its heightened otherworldly energy. The ectoplasm serves as protection for this Pokémon's core spirit.
It's highly skilled at tap-dancing. It waves its cane of ice in time with its graceful movements.
This Pokémon was born from sweet-smelling particles in the air. Its body is made of cream.
When it trusts a Trainer, it will treat them to berries it's decorated with cream.

It uses the horns on its head to sense the emotions of others. Males will act as valets for those they serve, looking after their every need.
As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It's also generating electricity.
It digs up the ground with its trunk. It's also very strong, being able to carry loads of over five tons without any problem at all.
They came over from another region long ago and worked together with humans. Their green skin is resistant to water.
In ancient times, it was unbeatable thanks to its powerful lower body, but it went extinct anyway after it depleted all its plant-based food sources.
The shaking of its freezing upper half is what generates its electricity. It has a hard time walking around.
Powerful legs and jaws made it the apex predator of its time. Its own overhunting of its prey was what drove it to extinction.
Though it's able to capture prey by freezing its surroundings, it has trouble eating the prey afterward because its mouth is on top of its head.
Its body resembles polished metal, and it's both lightweight and strong. The only drawback is that it rusts easily.
After being reborn as a ghost Pokémon, Dreepy wanders the areas it used to inhabit back when it was alive in prehistoric seas.
It's capable of flying faster than 120 mph. It battles alongside Dreepy and dotes on them until they successfully evolve.

Known as a legendary hero, this Pokémon absorbs metal particles, transforming them into a weapon it uses to battle.
In times past, it worked together with a king of the people to save the Galar region. It absorbs metal that it then uses in battle.

Kubfu trains hard to perfect its moves. The moves it masters will determine which form it takes when it evolves.

Within dense forests, this Pokémon lives in a pack with others of its kind. It's incredibly aggressive, and the other Pokémon of the forest fear it.
This Pokémon is a cluster of electrical energy. It's said that removing the rings on Regieleki's body will unleash the Pokémon's latent power.
An academic theory proposes that Regidrago's arms were once the head of an ancient dragon Pokémon. The theory remains unproven.
Glastrier emits intense cold from its hooves. It's also a belligerent Pokémon   anything it wants, it takes by force.
It probes its surroundings with all its senses save one  it doesn't use its sense of sight. Spectrier's kicks are said to separate soul from body.
Calyrex is a merciful Pokémon, capable of providing healing and blessings. It reigned over the Galar region in times of yore.
The black orbs shine with an uncanny light when the Pokémon is erecting invisible barriers. );

Floragato deftly wields the vine hidden beneath its long fur, slamming the hard flower bud against its opponents.
This Pokémon uses the reflective fur lining its cape to camouflage the stem of its flower, creating the illusion that the flower is floating.
Skeledirge's gentle singing soothes the souls of all that hear it. It burns its enemies to a crisp with flames of over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit.

It has its third set of legs folded up. When it's in a tough spot, this Pokémon jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.
When it decides to fight all out, it stands on its previously folded legs to enter Showdown Mode. It neutralizes its enemies in short order.
The pads of its paws are electricity-discharging organs. Pawmi fires electricity from its forepaws while standing unsteadily on its hind legs.

This Pokémon normally is slow to react, but once it enters battle, it will strike down its enemies with lightning-fast movements.
use their incisors to cut pieces out of any material that might be useful for a nest, then make off with them.

Dolliv shares its tasty, fresh- scented oil with others. This species has coexisted with humans since times long gone.
This Pokémon drives back enemies by launching its rich, aromatic oil at them with enough force to smash a boulder.
Green-feathered flocks hold the most sway. When they're out searching for food in the mornings and evenings, it gets very noisy.

Garganacl will rub its fingertips together and sprinkle injured Pokémon with salt. Even severe wounds will promptly heal afterward.
Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.
Armarouge evolved through the use of a set of armor that belonged to a distinguished warrior. This Pokémon is incredibly loyal.
The fiery blades on its arms burn fiercely with the lingering resentment of a sword wielder who fell before accomplishing their goal.

The green head has turned vicious due to the spicy chemicals stimulating its brain. Once it goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.

Flittle's toes levitate about half an inch above the ground because of the psychic power emitted from the frills on the Pokémon's belly.
It immobilizes opponents by bathing them in psychic power from its large eyes. Despite its appearance, it has a vicious temperament.

These Pokémon make their homes in piles of scrap metal. They test the strength of each other's hammers by smashing them together.

This Pokémon can pick up the scent of a Veluza just over 65 feet away and will hide itself in the sand.
A variety of fish Pokémon, Wugtrio was once considered to be a regional form of Dugtrio.

When attacked, this Pokémon will wield the tendrils on its body like fists and pelt the opponent with a storm of punches.
Glimmet's toxic mineral crystals look just like flower petals. This Pokémon scatters poisonous powder like pollen to protect itself.

This species left the ocean and began living on land a very long time ago. It seems to be closely related to Wailmer.

Veluza has excellent regenerative capabilities. It sheds spare flesh from its body to boost its agility, then charges at its prey.
It treats Tatsugiri like its boss and follows it loyally. Though powerful, Dondozo is apparently not very smart.
This is a small dragon Pokémon. It lives inside the mouth of Dondozo to protect itself from enemies on the outside.
When its anger rose beyond a critical point, this Pokémon gained power that is unfettered by the limits of its physical body.
When attacked, this Pokémon will retaliate by sticking thick spines out from its body. It's a risky move that puts everything on the line.
Now that the brain waves from the head and tail are synced up, the psychic power of this Pokémon is 10 times stronger than Girafarig's.
This Pokémon uses its hard tail to make its nest by boring holes into bedrock deep underground. The nest can reach lengths of over six miles.
Though it commands a massive army in battle, it's not skilled at devising complex strategies. It just uses brute strength to keep pushing.
Sightings of this Pokémon have occurred in recent years. The name Great Tusk was taken from a creature listed in a certain book.
There has been only one reported sighting of this Pokémon. It resembles a mysterious creature depicted in an old expedition journal.
It bears a slight resemblance to a Pokémon described in a dubious magazine as a cross between a dinosaur and a mushroom.
It has similar features to a ghostly pterosaur that was covered in a paranormal magazine, but the two have little else in common.
This mysterious Pokémon has some similarities to a creature that an old book introduced as Slither Wing.
It slightly resembles a Magneton that lived for 10,000 years and was featured in an article in a paranormal magazine.

Supposedly, the regrets of a tea ceremony master who died before perfecting his craft lingered in some matcha and became a Pokémon.
It pretends to be tea, trying to fool people into drinking it so it can drain their life-force. Its ruse is generally unsuccessful.
After all its muscles were stimulated by the toxic chain around its neck, Okidogi transformed and gained a powerful physique.
The chain is made from toxins that enhance capabilities. It stimulated Munkidori's brain and caused the Pokémon's psychic powers to bloom.
Fezandipiti owes its beautiful looks and lovely voice to the toxic stimulants emanating from the chain wrapped around its body.
This Pokémon's type changes based on which mask it's wearing. It confounds its enemies with nimble movements and kicks.
